page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Witheridge has a wide variety of housing.There are a number of old thatched cottages dating from over two hundred years and forming a conservation area.There are a number of victorian houses including a coach house (now the Mitre Hotel).After the second world war a large council estate was built and then added to this was a smaller estate of old people's bungalows during the last fifteen three new modern estates have been built.Most of these are bungalows ,detached and semi-detached , and are mainly occupied by elderly retired people.These bungalows have sold very easily because of their low cost but there is a constant movement of people in and out of the estates.There have been very few family houses built,just one row of terraced houses on one estate.
